prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: The latest lawyer to join our agency. She lived in Europe for a time, where she studied psychology.
Character 1
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: The head of our office. He was retired once, but made his return to the legal world a few months ago.
Character 2
Name: Apollo Justice
Description: The lawyer at my agency who was attacked during the court bombing trial. He's currently recovering at the hospital.
Character 3
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: An aspiring magician who Mr. Wright adopted when duty called.
Character 4
Name: Clay Terran
Description: The victim in this case. He was a HAT-2 crew member and a close friend of mine.
Character 5
Name: Juniper Woods
Description: Athena's childhood friend. Talented singer and Student Council President, she is studying to be a judge.
Character 6
Name: Solomon Starbuck
Description: The defendant in this case. He was a HAT-2 crew member and a mentor to the victim.
Character 7
Name: Simon Blackquill
Description: A prosecutor and prison inmate. He can manipulate witnesses through the power of suggestion.
Character 8
Name: Bobby Fulbright
Description: The detective assigned to this case. He led the evacuation effort at the Space Center after the bombing incident.
Character 9
Name: Candice Arme
Description: A detective who specialized in bomb cases. Was on detail at the Space Center. One of the first to find the body.
Character 10
Name: Yuri Cosmos
Description: The director of the Space Center and one of the first people to discover the body. He seems exceedingly full of himself.
Character 11
Name: Ponco
Description: A guide robot at the Space Center. She can provide information on the Center and show people around.
Character 12
Name: Aura Blackquill
Description: A researcher who's developing robots at the Space Center. She is Prosecutor Blackquill's older sister.
Character 13
Name: Clonco
Description: One of the robots developed by Aura, who refers to him as "Hunk of Junk".
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My cherished attorney's badge. Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.* (when playing as Apollo Justice) It's my all-important badge. Proof of my profession.* (when playing as Phoenix Wright)
Evidence 1
Name: Terran's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: Stabbing. The victim was discovered in the third-floor boarding lounge in the main building.
Evidence 2
Name: Space Center Diagram
Description: A cross-section view of the main building of the Space Center and Launch Pad 1.
Evidence 3
Name: Utility Knife
Description: The victim's blood was found on its blade, but no fingerprints could be lifted. It has the victim's blood on it. From a set of utility tools used by Space Center techs.
Evidence 4
Name: Bombing Report
Description: The explosions sparked a fire on the second floor of the main building and the middle level of the launch pad near the elevator.
Evidence 5
Name: Evacuation Report
Description: The bombs went off despite tight security. Police officers and riot police who had been standing by gave the evacuation instructions.
Evidence 6
Name: Launch Pad 1 Door Lock
Description: A biometric door lock operated by fingerprint recognition. Only the defendant, the victim, and the Space Center director had access. Starbuck's prints were found on this door lock. Also see photo taken after the incident. (2 pages.)
Evidence 7
Name: Security Camera Video
Description: Video showing the defendant and victim's escape from the corridor to the boarding lounge. Video showing the defendant and victim's escape from the corridor. The video ends immediately after this scene.
Evidence 8
Name: Oxygen Tank Data
Description: The victim's tank was ruptured, with 0% left. The defendant's had 80%. Remaining oxygen is displayed on left shoulder. The victim's oxygen tank was struck by a bullet.
Evidence 9
Name: Space Center Pamphlet
Description: A pamphlet for visitors to the Space Center. It includes a diagram of the boarding lounge. It includes a diagram of the boarding lounge and a cross-section view of the Space Center. (3 pages.)
Evidence 10
Name: Bullet Hole
Description: A single bullet hole was found in the boarding lounge. The bullet itself is missing. The only bullet hole found in the boarding lounge. It was made by a bullet fired from a .38-caliber gun.
Evidence 11
Name: Control Room Door Lock
Description: The door lock to the east. It can only be operated by the director. Backup power lets it function even when the power goes out.
Evidence 12
Name: Bullet
Description: Discovered in a gutter that runs along the south wall of the boarding lounge. It was fired from a .10 caliber handgun.
Evidence 13
Name: "Hope" Capsule
Description: Found in the victim's possession. It recently returned from a seven-year mission and contains asteroid samples.
Evidence 14
Name: Aura's Statement
Description: The perp held a lighter with an Earth emblem on it in their left hand, and a knife in their right.
Evidence 15
Name: Bullet from Arme's Gun
Description: The bullet found near the victim's oxygen tank. It was fired from a .38 caliber handgun.
Evidence 16
Name: Lighter
Description: The lighter found on the floor of the Space Museum. The true culprit's fingerprints are on it in the victim's blood. Evidence found by Detective Fulbright. It has Athena's prints on it in the victim's blood.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Detective Arme and I rushed towards the boarding lounge together.
Person: Cosmos
Testimony 1
Testimony: We went via the Control Room and peeked in from there to see what was going on inside.
Person: Cosmos
Testimony 2
Testimony: We saw a figure standing in the middle of the lounge, and Terran lying on the floor.
Person: Cosmos
Testimony 3
Testimony: I hate to say it, but I can only imagine the standing figure mast have been Starbuck.
Person: Cosmos
Testimony 4
Testimony: Detective Arme fired two warning shots at the figure.
Person: Cosmos

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. Let me start by going through each evidence and testimony to see where there might be inconsistencies.

First, looking at the characters and the scenario. The case involves the death of Clay Terran, a HAT-2 crew member, and the defendant is Solomon Starbuck. The key here is to find where a piece of evidence directly contradicts a testimony given by someone.

Let me list out the testimonies first:

Testimonies from Yuri Cosmos (Character 10):
- Testimony 0: He and Detective Arme went to the boarding lounge via the Control Room and saw a figure (presumably Starbuck) and Terran on the floor. Arme fired two warning shots.
- Testimony 1: They entered via the Control Room door.
- Testimony 2: They saw a figure standing and Terran on the floor.
- Testimony 3: The figure was Starbuck.
- Testimony 4: Arme fired two shots.

Now, looking at the evidences:

Evidence 15: Bullet from Arme's Gun is a .38 caliber bullet found near the victim's oxygen tank. It matches the caliber mentioned in Evidence 10 (bullet hole from .38). 

Evidence 12: A .10 caliber bullet found in a gutter. 

Testimony 4 says Arme fired two warning shots. If she fired two bullets, there should be two bullets found. However, Evidence 15 mentions only one bullet from a .38 (Arme's gun caliber), and Evidence 12 is a different caliber. That might indicate a discrepancy, but maybe the two shots could be the .38 and the .10? Not sure yet.

Looking at Evidence 10: The bullet hole in the boarding lounge is from a .38, which matches Arme's gun. So if Arme fired two shots, but only one bullet is found (Evidence 15), that could be a problem. But maybe one bullet is embedded somewhere else, but the testimony says two shots. Hmm.

Alternatively, looking at Evidence 7: Security Camera Video shows the defendant and victim escaping to the boarding lounge, and the video ends there. If Cosmos and Arme entered via the Control Room door (Testimony 1), but Evidence 11 says the Control Room door lock can only be operated by the director (Cosmos). Since Cosmos is the director, that's okay. But does that affect anything?

Wait, Testimony 1 says they went via the Control Room and peeked in. The door lock (Evidence 11) requires the director's access. Since Cosmos is the director, that's possible. So that part seems okay.

Another angle: Testimony 2 says they saw a figure standing and Terran on the floor. The autopsy (Evidence 1) says Terran was discovered in the third-floor boarding lounge. So that aligns. 

Wait, the contradiction might be in the bullets. Testimony 4 says two warning shots were fired. If each shot is a bullet, there should be two bullets. Evidence 15 is one .38 (from Arme's gun), and Evidence 12 is a .10. That's two bullets, but different calibers. If Arme's gun is .38, then the two shots should be .38 each. But there's only one .38 found (Evidence 15), and another .10 (maybe from someone else). So that could be a contradiction: testimony says two shots from Arme (both .38), but evidence shows only one .38 and another .10. Hence, missing a bullet or inconsistency in caliber.

Alternatively, maybe the two shots are the .38 (Evidence 15) and the .10 (Evidence 12), but that would mean someone else fired the .10. Then the testimony's claim that Arme fired two would be wrong if only one .38 was found. 

Alternatively, maybe the .10 bullet (Evidence 12) is from the warning shots, but that contradicts the testimony that Arme's gun is .38. 

This seems like a possible contradiction between Testimony 4 (two shots from Arme's .38) and Evidence 12 (a .10 bullet found) plus Evidence 15 (one .38). Since two shots would need two bullets of .38, but only one is found. So the testimony's claim of two shots might contradict the evidence of only one .38 bullet found. 

Alternatively, maybe the two shots are the one .38 (Evidence 15) and another that's unaccounted for, but the existence of the .10 could be from another source. 

Alternatively, looking at another angle: Testimony 3 says the figure was Starbuck. Evidence 3 is the utility knife with Terran's blood but no prints. If Starbuck used that, but no prints, maybe he's not the killer. But that's more about guilt than contradiction.

Wait, another point: Evidence 16 is a lighter with Athena's prints in blood. That might not relate directly here.

Wait, let me check another evidence. Evidence 7's security camera video ends when they entered the boarding lounge. If Cosmos and Arme entered later, maybe the video doesn't capture them. Not sure.

Alternatively, Testimony 1 says they went via the Control Room. Evidence 11's door lock to the Control Room requires the director's access. Since Cosmos is the director, that's okay. So no contradiction there.

Hmm. The main possible contradiction is the number and caliber of bullets. Testimony 4 says two warning shots (from Arme's .38), but Evidence 15 shows one .38 bullet and Evidence 12 a .10. So if two shots were fired, there should be two .38 bullets, but only one is found. That would mean either the testimony is wrong about the number, or the bullets aren't accounted for. 

Alternatively, the two shots could be the one .38 and the .10, but that would mean another person fired the .10, contradicting the testimony that only Arme fired. 

Thus, the contradiction is between Testimony 4 (two shots from Arme's gun, .38) and Evidence 12 (a .10 bullet found) plus Evidence 15 (only one .38). 

So, the pair would be Evidence 12 and Testimony 4, or Evidence 15 and Testimony 4. Wait, the question asks for one pair. The user might expect one of these. 

Alternatively, looking at Evidence 10: the bullet hole is from a .38. If two shots were fired, one might be in the wall (the hole) and the other bullet could be the one in Evidence 15 near the tank. But then that's two .38 bullets. But Evidence 12 is a different caliber, so that's an extra bullet. 

Hmm, perhaps the key is that the testimony says two shots, but only one .38 bullet is found (Evidence 15) and another bullet of different caliber (Evidence 12). Therefore, the testimony's claim of two shots from Arme's gun would be contradicted by the evidence of only one .38 bullet and an unrelated .10. 

Thus, the contradiction is between Testimony 4 and Evidence 12 or 15. The user wants one pair. Since the question says "which evidence and testimony contradict each other", the best fit would be between Testimony 4 and Evidence 12, because the .10 bullet isn't from Arme's gun. 

Alternatively, the main point is that two shots should mean two .38 bullets, but only one is found. Hence, Testimony 4 (two shots) vs Evidence 15 (only one .38 bullet found). But the problem is that the bullet hole (Evidence 10) is another .38. So the total would be two .38 (Evidence 10 and 15) plus the .10. That would mean two from Arme and one from else. But the testimony says two shots by Arme. Then maybe the bullet hole (Evidence 10) is one, and the bullet in Evidence 15 is the second. So two .38 bullets account for the two shots. But then the .10 (Evidence 12) is from someone else. In that case, there's no contradiction. 

Hmm, maybe I'm overcomplicating. Let me check other evidences. 

Wait, Evidence 15 is the bullet from Arme's gun, which is a .38. The bullet hole (Evidence 10) is also .38. So that's two .38 bullets: one embedded in the wall (the hole) and one on the ground (Evidence 15). That would account for two shots. Then the .10 (Evidence 12) is from someone else. Then Testimony 4's claim of two shots from Arme would align with the two .38 bullets. So no contradiction there. 

Therefore, maybe another contradiction exists elsewhere. 

Looking again at Testimony 1: They went via the Control Room and peeked in. Evidence 11 says the Control Room door can only be opened by the director (Cosmos), which he is, so that's okay. 

Testimony 2 says they saw a figure standing in the lounge. Evidence 7's security camera video ends when they entered the boarding lounge. So the video doesn't show the scene Cosmos describes. If the video stops before Cosmos and Arme arrive, then the testimony's account isn't captured on camera, but that's not a contradiction unless the video should show it. The testimony's account isn't contradicted by the video's end. 

Another angle: The autopsy (Evidence 1) says cause of death was stabbing. The utility knife (Evidence 3) has Terran's blood but no prints. If Starbuck used that, but no prints, maybe he wore gloves. But that's about guilt, not contradiction. 

Wait, Testimony 3 says the figure was Starbuck. Evidence 16's lighter has Athena's prints, but that's unrelated. 

Hmm, maybe looking at Testimony 4: Arme fired two warning shots. Evidence 15 is one bullet from her gun. Evidence 10 is the bullet hole (another .38). So that's two .38 bullets, accounting for two shots. Thus, no contradiction. 

Then perhaps another contradiction: 

Testimony 2 says they saw the figure standing and Terran on the floor. The autopsy says Terran was discovered in the boarding lounge, so that's consistent. 

Wait, maybe Evidence 7's security camera video shows the defendant (Starbuck) and victim entering the boarding lounge, but if Cosmos and Arme arrived later and saw Starbuck there, then the video ending when they entered the lounge would not show Starbuck leaving. If the video ends when they entered the lounge, then the video might not show Starbuck leaving, but that's not a contradiction. 

Alternatively, if the testimony claims that when they arrived, Starbuck was standing there, but the video shows him entering, maybe timing is an issue. But without exact times, hard to say. 

Hmm, perhaps I'm missing something. Let's try another approach.

Looking for an evidence that directly contradicts a testimony.

Testimony 4 says Arme fired two warning shots. If the evidence shows only one bullet from her gun, that would be a problem. But as per Evidence 15 and Evidence 10, there are two .38 bullets (one in the wall, one on the ground), so that matches two shots. The .10 is another bullet, but that's from someone else. So Testimony 4 is okay. 

Another point: Testimony 0 says they rushed towards the boarding lounge via Control Room. Evidence 11 says the Control Room door requires director access. Since Cosmos is the director, that's okay. 

Wait, maybe the contradiction is between Testimony 3 (figure was Starbuck) and Evidence 6 (Launch Pad 1 Door Lock has Starbuck's prints). If Starbuck was in the area, that's consistent, but not a contradiction. 

Alternatively, Evidence 16's lighter with Athena's prints might be a red herring. 

Wait, looking at Testimony 4 again: Arme fired two warning shots. Evidence 15 is one bullet from her gun, and Evidence 10's bullet hole is another. That's two .38 bullets, so two shots. Thus, no contradiction there. 

Hmm, maybe I'm overcomplicating. Let me check other testimonies and evidences again.

Evidence 7's security camera video ends when they (defendant and victim) entered the boarding lounge. So the video doesn't show what happened after they entered, like the stabbing or the arrival of Cosmos and Arme. Therefore, the testimony's account (seeing the figure and Terran on the floor) isn't captured on video, but that's not a contradiction, just missing info.

Another possible contradiction: Testimony 2 says they saw the figure standing and Terran on the floor. The autopsy (Evidence 1) says cause of death was stabbing. If the stabbing happened before they arrived, then that's okay. No contradiction here.

Wait, maybe the key is in the bullets' locations. The bullet from Arme's gun (Evidence 15) is near the oxygen tank, which was struck by a bullet (Evidence 8). So that bullet might be the one that damaged the tank, leading to Terran's death? But the cause was stabbing. Hmm, the oxygen tank damage might be separate.

Alternatively, the bullet hole in the boarding lounge (Evidence 10) could be from one of Arme's shots. 

I'm stuck. Let me try to think of other pairs.

Looking at Evidence 14: Aura's statement says the perp had a lighter and knife. Evidence 16 is the lighter found with Athena's prints. If Athena is the perp, that contradicts her being the lawyer. But that's more about guilt than contradiction between evidence and testimony.

Wait, Testimony 3 says the figure was Starbuck. Evidence 3 is the utility knife with Terran's blood but no prints. If Starbuck used it, but no prints, maybe he wore gloves, so no contradiction. 

Alternatively, maybe the contradiction is between Testimony 4 and Evidence 12. Testimony 4 says Arme fired two .38 shots. Evidence 12 shows a .10 bullet, which couldn't be from her. So if two shots were fired, but one was .10, that's a contradiction. But the two shots are supposed to be from Arme's gun, which is .38. Thus, the existence of a .10 bullet not from her would mean someone else fired, but the testimony only mentions Arme's shots. Hence, the testimony's claim that only Arme fired two shots (both .38) is contradicted by the presence of a .10 bullet (Evidence 12), implying another shooter. 

That would mean Testimony 4 and Evidence 12 contradict each other. 

So the answer would be {"evidence":12, "testimony":4}.
</think>

So the testimony's claim that the figure fired at them might be contradicted by the evidence that the only bullet from the area related to the shooting is Arme's .38, suggesting that Arme fired the shot, not the figure. Evidence 15 is .38 from Arme's gun, which would be from when Arme fired warning shots (as per Cosmos' testimony Testimony 4).
